meanings.definition: Cause to feel embarrassed, disconcerted, or ashamed.
meanings.sent1: His teasing remarks were abashing her in front of everyone.
meanings.sent2: She was abashing herself for forgetting her lines during the play.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter kept abashing himself by spilling drinks on the customers.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected question abashed him, leaving him speechless.
meanings.sent5: The spotlight on stage was abashing her, making her feel exposed and vulnerable.

meanings.sent1: He was abashing after realizing his mistake in front of his classmates.
meanings.sent2: She abashed easily when receiving compliments, blushing furiously.
meanings.sent3: The puppy looked abashed after being scolded for chewing on the shoes.
meanings.sent4: His face turned red, abashing him as he tripped in front of the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected praise left her abashed, not used to being in the spotlight.
